page.title: 19WILDLIFE AROUND ADELAIDE(ii)
page.content: On Wades Farm are barn owl,kestrel, lark,linnet,a sparrowhawk and reed bunting.Mammals include two families of foxes and another with their earth in the railway embankment;stoats,rats, weasels,water voles,field mice and rabbits.Peacock,tortoiseshell,red admiral and cabbage white are the most common butterflies.Plants include nettles,willow herb,cow parsley,poppy, mallow and dandelion. On the farmland trees include willow,hawthorn and alder,with elder bushes.Around the fields and the houses in Adelaide are lines of poplar trees,which act as windbreaks.Wades Farm has planted many new hedges and has also left corners of land between fields as wild areas for pheasant and partridge.
